title: The science of calling in sick: how do you know if you're too ill to work
text:
It's a pleasant morning: the sun is high in the sky, the birds are singing, even the rain is holding off for a bit. You’ve managed to make the train on time and there are no disruptions from here to the office. For once, everything is right with the world.

Achoo!

What was that? You flinch, prick your ears. And then behind you, a sniffle. To your left, a cough. Suddenly the whole carriage is awash with snorts and snuffles and sneezes. You realise you are currently taking a giant communal bath in the collective germs of your fellow passengers.

Yep, it’s that time of year again, folks. Cold and flu season is upon us.

Being ill has never been fun – but these days, we make things doubly hard for...
